abstract: New York State Senate confirms David R Jones and Veronica Vanterpool to serve on Metropolitan Transportation Authority board; members, both recommended by Mayor Bill de Blasio, give New York City stronger voice at state-run agency during time when subways are overcrowded and authority weighs decision to shut down L train between Manhattan and Brooklyn for prolonged period for repairs.

headline.print_headline: Two New Board Members Give City a Louder Voice at the M.T.A.
headline.main: New York’s Voice at the M.T.A. Gets Louder, as 2 Mayoral Board Picks Are Confirmed

snippet: Over the past year, Mayor Bill de Blasio has had just one representative at the transit agency. Two more were approved by the State Senate.
lead_paragraph: Over the past year, Mayor Bill de Blasio has had just one representative at the transit agency. Two more were approved by the State Senate.
